Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Crinicepsin-1 (Gly-rich; natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals, XXA; UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide shows 45.4% similarity toUrechistachykinin II.Activity: Weakly active against S. aureus (MIC 81 uM), Gram- E.coli MTCC 2692 (MIC 162 uM), P.aeruginosa MTCC 8076 (MIC 162 uM), and V.cholerae McV 09 (MIC 162 uM). Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Bhagavathula N, Meedidoddi V, Bourque S, Vimaladevi R, Kesavakurup S, Selvadurai D, Shrivastava S, Krishnappa C. 2017
Literature Information.Reference: Arch Insect Biochem Physiol. 2017 Apr;94(4). doi: 10.1002/arch.21381.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Characterization of two novel antimicrobial peptides from the cuticular extracts of the ant Trichomyrmex criniceps (Mayr), (Hymenoptera: Formicidae).
